column4: can someone please freakin help me, ive asked my question like 6 times now.
if nobody knows this, then this distro is definately sol.
all I did was mess up the config of xwindows. how do I revert it back to the defaults?
thats all I have been asking.
well, I didnt know where xorg.conf was until it was messed up. nor did I think xwin would crash on a simple thing like extending my desktop to a second monitor
you're out of luck when you go messing with system files as root without making backups or knowing what you're doing.
I have patience, but I would thing after asking my question for the past hour someone would help. :(
did you read my problem. I wasnt messing with system files, i was in the display setting on xwin.
no, I just joined a couple minutes ago.  Ubuntu doesn't ship with a settings applet by that name.
If you dont understand my question, or anybodies for the matter, it would be helpful to me, to ask me to rephrase it. :( instead of feeling ignored.
do note that the people in here who answer questions are volunteering their spare time to do so.  Please consider that while choosing how to approach getting help in here.
that answer didnt fix it. But I figure I'll give it another hour on my own. if not, back to windows for me.
amason, I do thank you for your help. I just get frustrated when I get ignored for an hour, then it takes me to show im a bit peeved to get a response from people.
Again, being a drama queen doesn't help.  Most of us really don't care what you choose to use, so threatening to leave is neither reputable nor effective.
there are 1118 nicks in this channel as of writing.  Very few of them are advanced, long-time linux users.  What exactly is your threshold for being "ignored"?
